title: Debugging HTTP 500 Internal Server Error on a Custom Web Application: Seeking Expert Advice
content:
Hello,

I’m encountering an HTTP 500 Internal Server Error on a custom web application that I’ve been developing. The error occurs intermittently and is not tied to any specific action or user input. I’ve checked the server logs and they show generic error messages without much detail.

Here’s what I’ve tried so far:

Checked server resource utilization and logs Reviewed application code for potential issues Verified database connections and configurations Despite these efforts, the issue persists. I’m looking for advanced troubleshooting tips or any specific tools that can help diagnose and resolve this issue. Screenshots and log excerpts are attached for further context.

Any insights or recommendations would be greatly appreciated!

Thanks in advance.
creator: robertdavid5416

title: On YouTube I am constantly seeing "Connect to the Internet You're offline. Check your connection." I AM CONNECTED!!!
content:
I am constantly seeing this message on YouTube. I don't have troubles with any other website. I get this message yet other tabs will happily load different pages. I have a fibre connection, I am definitely connected! I have tried everything I can find to remedy this problem but nothing works, for example a flush DNS command. And yes, of course it absolutely still happens in troubleshoot mode.

This has been happening for over a year now and it is absolutely driving me insane. Whenever this happens I can open another browser and will have none of these problems with that browser. I have been using Firefox for over 20 years religiously, but I am getting so sick of this that if I don't find a solution for this problem soon I will be done with Firefox, I don't even know why I've persisted with this problem for so long. Please help!!!
creator: noizeboy

title: Ignores don't autoupdate setting and resets it to autoupdate on reload
content:
This is a persistent issue for many a version. I've tried these config settings too and it still consistently-inconsistent resets it sometimes. app.update.auto (->false) app.update.auto.migrated (->false) app.update.enabled (->false) app.update.service.enabled (->false) DisableAppUpdate (->true)

It does this on closing hanging browser or on system power off (without closing browser manually). Also if setting is set to don't update -> close browser within a minute -> when reopened it is on autoupdate again.
creator: gendalf

title: Why are my search results coming up in Russian?
content: My searches (regardless of Engine) are coming up in Russian. I don't speak Russian. It does not seem to be the search engine, and does not happen in Chrome, only Firefox.
